definition: Song Qi (998-1061), Song dynasty poet and writer, coauthor of History of the Later Tang Dynasty 新唐書|新唐书
surname Song/the Song dynasty (960-1279)/also Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479)
surname Qi
large/vast

sentences.english: Secondly, it mainly discusses literature thought of Song Qi.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，主要对宋祁文学思想进行论述。

sentences.english: Thirdly, it mainly discusses the poems of Song Qi.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分，主要就宋祁诗歌创作进行论述。

definition: Ouyang Xiu (1007-1072), Northern Song dynasty prose writer and historian
Xue Juzheng (912-981), Song historian and compiler of History of the Five Dynasties between Tang and Song 舊五代史|旧五代史
Yang Yi (974-1020), Northern Song dynasty writer and poet
Wang Anshi (1021-1086), Song dynasty politician and writer, one of the Eight Giants 唐宋八大家
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
Fan Zhongyan (989-1052), minister of Northern Song who led the failed reform of 1043, author of On Yueyang Tower 岳陽樓記|岳阳楼记
Li Yu (c. 937-978), given name of the final ruler of Tang of the Five Southern dynasties Li Houzhu 李後主|李后主, a renowned poet
Kou Zhun (961-1023), Northern Song politician and poet
Su Zhe (1039-1112), Northern Song writer and calligrapher, one of the 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of the 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]
Liu Yong (987-1053), Song poet
Wang Yucheng (954-1001) Song dynasty literary figure
Sima Guang (1019-1086), politician and historian of Northern Song, author of Comprehensive Mirror for aid in Government 資治通鑒|资治通鉴
Xu Xuan (-991), author of commentaries on Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字註|说文解字注[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4 Zhu4]
Fang Xuanling (579-648), Tang dynasty historian, compiler of History of Jin dynasty 晉書|晋书
Li Linfu (-752), Tang politician, chancellor under Tang emperor Xuanzong 玄宗
Zhao Yi (1727-1814), Qing dynasty poet and historian, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家
